rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.DOMAIN

classVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
classVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.USUBJID

classVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
classVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
classVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.POOLID

classVariables.description: An identifier used to identify a result from a group of subjects that is not assignable to a specific subject.
classVariables.label: Pool Identifier
classVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPDEVID

classVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device
classVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
classVariables.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SEQ

classVariables.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
classVariables.label: Sequence Number
classVariables.name: --SEQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--GRPID

classVariables.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset (Section 3.4).
classVariables.label: Group ID
classVariables.name: --GRPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--REFID

classVariables.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID, or UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: Reference ID
classVariables.name: --REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SPID

classVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.
classVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
classVariables.name: --SPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKID

classVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For Example: A single tumor may have multiple measurements/assessments performed at each study visit.
classVariables.label: Link ID
classVariables.name: --LNKID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKGRP

classVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. For example: Multiple tumor measurements/assessments will contribute to a single response to therapy determination record.
classVariables.label: Link Group ID
classVariables.name: --LNKGRP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITNUM

classVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
classVariables.label: Visit Number
classVariables.name: VISITNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISIT

classVariables.label: Visit Name
classVariables.name: VISIT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITDY

classVariables.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

classVariables.name: VISITDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.TAETORD

classVariables.name: TAETORD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.EPOCH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DTC

classVariables.name: --STDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDTC

classVariables.description: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
classVariables.label: End Date/Time of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DY

classVariables.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

classVariables.name: --DY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

classVariables.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
classVariables.name: --STDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDY

classVariables.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Study Day of End of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DUR

classVariables.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
classVariables.label: Duration
classVariables.name: --DUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPT

classVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
classVariables.name: --TPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTNUM

classVariables.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
classVariables.name: --TPTNUM

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

classVariables.description: Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
classVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
classVariables.name: --ELTM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTREF

classVariables.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
classVariables.label: Time Point Reference
classVariables.name: --TPTREF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RFTDTC

classVariables.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
classVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --RFTDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRF

classVariables.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before, during, or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.  Note: This variable will be deprecated (phased out) in a future (post SDTM v1.4) release. The functionality of this variable can be replaced by the use of --STRTPT with --STTPT = RFSTDTC.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --STRF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRF

classVariables.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before, during or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.  Note: This variable will be deprecated (phased out) in a future (post SDTM v1.4) release. The functionality of this variable can be replaced by the use of --ENRTPT with --ENTPT = RFENDTC.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --ENRF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVLINT

classVariables.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire such as SF-36.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
classVariables.name: --EVLINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVINTX

classVariables.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: LIFETIME, LAST NIGHT, RECENTLY, OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval Text
classVariables.name: --EVINTX

priorVersion.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STTPT

classVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
classVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STTPT

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --ENTPT.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENTPT

classVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
classVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STINT

classVariables.description: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval in ISO 8601 character format relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).
classVariables.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --STINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENINT

classVariables.description: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval in ISO 8601 character format relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).
classVariables.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --ENINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DETECT

classVariables.description: The number of days from the start of dosing to the earliest detection of a condition or pathogen.
classVariables.label: Time in Days to Detection
classVariables.name: --DETECT

classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.4, Section 2.2)

classes.name: General Observations

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--SCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

classVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from --ORRES in a standard format or in standard units. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".
